intro: Galium orientale var. glabrum, commonly known as smooth woodryard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its berries are dark blue to black when mature and are often consumed by birds. Galium orientale var. glabrum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
